Body:
I'm getting error {SQLite.Net.SQLiteException: Could not open database file: C:\Data\Users\DefaultAccount\Documents\Storage.db (CannotOpen) when trying to connect to sqllite database on a raspberry pi 3, with WIN IOT is the OS. I'm using the SQLite.Net-PCL ver 3.1.1 implementation of SQLite.

var documentsPath = System.Environment.GetFolderPath(System.Environment.SpecialFolder.Personal);    var fileName2 = Storage.db";	var path2 = Path.Combine(documentsPath
column9: fileName2);     		try	        {	            using (var connection = new SQLiteConnection(new SQLite.Net.Platform.WinRT.SQLitePlatformWinRT()
column10: path2)) { } } catch (Exception ex) { string m_er = ex.ToString(); } "

Body:
I suppose you use UWP application. On Windows IoT Core you can use FolderPermissions tool to make this path "C:\Data\Users\DefaultAccount\Documents" accessible to a UWP app.

FolderPermissions C:\Data\Users\DefaultAccount\Documents -e

Since you don't receive "access denied" error so I suppose you have already added the following capability in the Package.appxmanifest.

<uap:Capability Name="documentsLibrary" />

Then your code will work. (I test on Raspberry Pi 3 with Windows IoT Core version 10.0.17763.107)

"
Setting the permission on the folder C:\Data\Users\DefaultAccount\Documents" fixed the problem. Thanks very Much!"
Yes this issue is closed. Thanks again.

I added line; md.CreateTable<RaspTables.Category>(); after the md= new line and received error; SQLite.Net.SQLiteException: disk I/O error. I've checked and the storage.db and storage.db-journal both have read write permissions. I see that it's been suggested to set the flags for the database, QLiteOpenFlags.ReadWrite | SQLiteOpenFlags.Create | SQLiteOpenFlags.FullMutex, but I don't see how to do that?
Hi @Dave, it seems the can not open" issue has solved
column9: right? If it is true you can reference ["Help Center > Answering"](https://stackoverflow.com/help/accepted-answer) so we can complete this issue. And I see you have post a [new question of the issue about CreateTable](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/54348519/how-to-add-tags-to-sqlite-connection) so we will continue there."
